description: Oksana Lintz decides to become a public witness at the tribunal, determined to expose BCI abuses and seek justice despite personal risk.
The Council responds to mounting public unrest by announcing a televised citywide tribunal to investigate BCI errors. Oksana Lintz is named as a key witness.

Oksana testifies that her team was ordered to suppress evidence of BCI errors and wrongful sanctions. Her candid statement sparks fierce debate—some hail her as a whistleblower, others blame her for complicity.

Under pressure, Innovator Council members deflect blame onto past BCI design flaws and outdated protocols, promising future reform. The Council issues a statement of 'remedial intent' without admitting direct fault.
The tribunal promises partial reparations to those harmed by BCI abuse. Many citizens remain wary, as concrete details are lacking and confidence in the leadership is still fractured.
